diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with RUQ pain after eating, accompanied by dry heaves, and with a history of chronic epigastric pain. Imaging (CT abdomen) revealed a 7 x 9 x 5 cm phlegmon in the right upper quadrant involving the cecum and distal ileum, with extensive mesenteric fat stranding and fluid tracking down the right paracolic gutter, suggesting perforation.
